TextBlock.Text: CASSAVA: Though I have searched tirelessly, I have found no trace of any of my fellow Nomai.. I am alone.
CASSAVA: Everywhere I search, the star system has been engulfed by this strange substance, only visible to the third eye.
CASSAVA: My only solace is the survival of several water-dwelling species native to this star system.. A discovery that affirms what my observations on the matter's properties.
CASSAVA: But that also means.. If any of them were to ever surface from the safety of the water...
CASSAVA: What.. What a terrifying thought. I owe this planet's clouds my deepest gratitude for obscuring the Quantum Moon from my sight..
CASSAVA: A note of utmost importance to myself: I must be sure never to trap the Quantum Moon in superposition around Giant's Deep for any extended amount of time.
